definition: (of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)

sentences.english: We beached the boat and headed inland.
sentences.chinese: 我們想使船靠岸，朝內陸方向駛去。

sentences.english: The captain used the dinghy to go from the ship to the shore.
sentences.chinese: 船長用小划艇離船靠岸。

sentences.english: A lamp exploded in one of them near the shore and the fire speedily spread.
sentences.chinese: 其中一條靠岸的船上的油燈爆炸，火勢迅速蔓延。

sentences.english: Egypt was persuaded to receive the vessel.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被說服允許這艘船靠岸。

sentences.english: He also makes home-brewed beer that he trades for prawns from trawlers that sometimes anchor off shore.
sentences.chinese: 他也自釀啤酒以與過往靠岸停泊的旅行者們交換對蝦。

sentences.english: Once the boat docked, Obama and Kathrada walked to the now empty prison.
sentences.chinese: 船一靠岸，奧巴馬和卡特拉達就走向現在空着的監獄。

sentences.english: Before the boat could reach shore, a storm had set in.
sentences.chinese: 那條船還沒來得及靠岸，就開始颳起暴風雨來了。

sentences.english: Finally, we arrived safely in Krabi.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我們終於安全靠岸了。

sentences.english: As the sun set we docked at Fengdu.
sentences.chinese: 太陽落山時，我們的船在豐都靠岸。

sentences.english: He beached the boat and lifted the boy onto the shore.
sentences.chinese: 他將船靠岸並把男孩託舉到岸上。

sentences.english: When Kidd came ashore to New York City, he learned he had been declared a pirate.
sentences.chinese: 基德在紐約靠岸時，他才得知自己已經被認定爲海盜。

sentences.english: We bank over a landscape where the wheat fields are sheets of gold leaf.
sentences.chinese: 我們靠岸在一個地形上，在那裏麥田是張張金箔。

sentences.english: Our next landfall should be jamaica .
sentences.chinese: 我們下一靠岸處應是牙買加。

sentences.english: The boats beached and the soldiers got out.
sentences.chinese: 船隻靠岸後士兵們下船。
